intro: Hieracium aestivum subsp. angustiforme, commonly known as narrowleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. Native to Europe, it is often found in grasslands and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and has a creeping rootstock. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils.
